page.title: 12COPPERAS WOOD - HISTORY
page.content: {Copperas Wood Nature Reserve}is thirty eight and a half acres of woodland and shore, situated between the Wrabness Road and the River Stour, one mile from Ramsey village. The wood is between{300 and 500 years old}and mainly consists of{sweet chestnuts which were planted originally for their timber.It was managed as a {commercial concern}until the 1940's.Then the market for the timber had{declined}because farming was changing in the area from pastural to arable (as it is today). There was, therefore, less demand for fence posts and fencing. The owner decided to abandon the business, there being no buyer. It remained overgrown and neglected until it was bought, some six years ago by the{Essex Naturalist {Trust.
